Title: Cylinder Seal with Figures with Conical Hats
Dimensions: 1 x 7/16 in. (2.6 x 1.2 cm) (h. x diam.)
Description: Scene depicts a standing deity in horned headdress and long robe, with one foot resting on an animal (?) at feet and holding a mace in outstretched hand. Facing, is a second deity in horned headdress and long tufted robe, with both hands raised. In the field between them is a star cradled in a disk. The scene also incorporates a cuneiform inscription in five registers.
Provenance: Sadie Jones (Mrs. Henry Walters), New York [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Sale, Joseph Brummer, New York, 1941; Walters Art Museum, 1941, by purchase.
Creator: Near Eastern
